item.title: Style transfer
item.description: tags Computer vision Style transfer is the process of transferring some visual features from one image to another image while preserving the latter’s content information. Since both these notions may be considered subjective, the problem of style transfer is not well defined and may be approached in many ways. Style transfer with CNNs This is an early example of style transfer with convolutional neural networks: (Gatys et al. 2016)

item.title: Style transfer with generative adversarial neural networks
item.description: Links Project slides Description This project’s goal was to implement style transfer techniques based on GANs. We applied several algorithms on our own datasets of landscape pictures scraped from Flickr and frames from anime extracted automatically.
